caption: b"Aung Ja, now 19, is a trafficking survivor from Kachin, Myanmar, who was rescued and returned to her village. She is now recovering with the support of a program implemented by UN Women's local partner, Htoi Gender and Development Foundation. The latter has already trained 125 survivors of trafficking, women in communities at risk, and in camps and villages of displaced people.\n\nSupport @onufemmesfr in the fight to stop violence against women http://bnpp.io/EV1S50CzABH #OrangeTheWorld"

b"Jonanitha Katunzi received training on women's rights through a partnership between @unwomen and a local organization, Equality for Growth. Since taking the course, Katunzi has become a landowner and educated her three children. Support UN Women in the fight to stop violence against women. Jonanitha Katunzi received training on women's rights through a partnership between UN Women and a local organization, Equality for Growth. Since taking the course, Katunzi has become a landowner and educated her three children. Support UN Women in the fight to stop violence against women. http://bnpp.io/t49G50CzaN6 #OrangeTheWorld"

b"Asse\xcc\x81tou Toure\xcc\x81, a 49-year-old Malian woman, survivor of genital mutilation, has devoted most of her life to the fight against this harmful practice. Since 2011, @onufemmesfr has promoted women's rights and supported prevention of gender-based violence, including excisions in Mali, through a program with funding from France. 
 
Support ONU Femmes France in the fight to stop violence against women https://www.onufemmes.fr

#onu #woman #women #Africa #droits #femme #mali #travelgram #humanity"

caption:
b'What if it was you? 

This series aims to share the different perspectives of people who are brought together by their commitment, conviction, and common effort to create a more united world. 

Don\xe2\x80\x99t miss the last episod on the previous IGTV post about our colleague A. Cippone (BNL) involved w/ NGO Agevolando to support care leavers in Italy :Italy:. These are young people, like social educator S. Marra, who leave foster homes to find themselves on their own.
/@Loopsider'

b'In this episode, discover the story of our colleagueAndrea Cippone, ESG Risks, BNL :Italy: , who co-founded the NGO Agevolando to support care leavers. These are young people across Italy, like social educator Stefano Marra, who leave foster homes and other state institutions to find themselves on their own. \n\n\xe2\x80\x9cAnd what if it was you?\xe2\x80\x9d a collaboration with @loopsider powered by BNP Paribas.'

b'Belgian Flemish artist, teacher, dancer and choreographer Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker is a figurehead in the world of international choreography. 

Her latest solo creation \xe2\x80\x9cThe Goldberg Variations, BWV 988\xe2\x80\x9d which Anne Teresa De Keersmaeker performs herself, accompanied by pianist Pavel Kolesnikov, was presented first in France on 13 October at the Montpellier dance festival 40 bis.

Since meeting the @fondationbnpp in 2013, a partnership based on the transmission of a cultural heritage has been built..
.

:copyright: Anne Van Aerschot

.
#art #fondation #soutien #creation #mecenat #artiste #artist'

b'Supported by the @fondationbnpp since early 2020, the choreographer @alexandervantournhout and his company, presented the world premiere of Through the Grapevine, its new creation, on 3 October in Marseille.

Circus?  Dance?  Alexander Vantournhout chose not to choose.  And he was right: in just a few years, the 30-something-year-old has become the contemporary scene\xe2\x80\x99s new sensation.

His creations put the bodies of his performers, including himself, through strenuous physical paces or bring them into relationships with unlikely objects in order to "explore the creative and kinetic potential of physical limits". 
.

:copyright: Bart Grietens

.
#art #dance #danse #artiste #potd #creation #artist #fondation #circus'

b'@kaoriitohime is a Japanese dancer and choreographer supported by the BNP Paribas Foundation since 2015 who has worked with the greatest choreographers of her generation. Based in France since the early 2000s, she has performed with many ballet companies worldwide. 

She presented her new creation \xe2\x80\x9cChers\xe2\x80\x9d in october in Marseille. Kaori Ito created this piece working with letters that the dancers had written to their lost loved ones. Kaori Ito invites our ghosts on stage. Dancing to talk with the dead, to say goodbye and forgive the living. :ghost: :woman_dancing: 

During the \xe2\x80\x9cSemaine d\xe2\x80\x99Art en Avignon\xe2\x80\x9d organized by the @festivalavignon from 23 to 31 October another piece of the choreographer is programmed, \xe2\x80\x9cLe Tambour de Soie\xe2\x80\x9d co-written with Yoshi Oi\xcc\x88da, and inspired by a traditional No\xcc\x82 theatre play, a traditional Japanese theatre art.

The @fondationbnpp has supported the choreographer Kaori Ito and her company Hime\xcc\x81 aligned with its commitment to contemporary creation which is placed at the heart of its cultural philanthropy strategy. :clapping_hands: :folded_hands: 
.

:copyright: Gregory Batardon

.
#art #portrait #creation #mecenat #fondation #automne'

b'Yoann Bourgeois reinvents tirelessly his favorite subjects in his creations. The question of vertigo in particular: \xe2\x80\x9cThe loss of landmarks has always been a concern for humans. In light of the historic times we are going through, this loss resonates in a new way. At times of profound disruption, the representation of spatial and temporal disorientation speaks to all of us.\xe2\x80\x9d\n \nPhoto credits: Celui qui tombe - Yoann Bourgeois :copyright: G\xc3\xa9raldine Aresteanu'

b'In 2019, our #philanthropic initiatives for #culture represented just above 21% of the global BNP Paribas corporate philanthropy budget across the world and across various artistic disciplines : contemporary dance, jazz, new circus arts but also exhibitions, museums, architecture, theatre, literature or classical music and even cinema ! \n \nPhoto credits: Compagnie XY \xe2\x80\x93 :copyright: Cholette Lefebure'

b'In 2020, the @fondationbnpp celebrates 25 years of support to #jazz, 25 years of fidelity and passion which benefited to over 30 artists and bands as well as thirty festivals and institutions. At the heart of its support: contemporary creation and those who create, the musicians themselves. @vonpourquery is one of them. 

The BNP Paribas Foundation supports Thomas de Pourquery in the development of his projects since 2019. Composer, saxophonist but also singer and actor, the artist is versatile and his music is magnetic and contagious! In his life and his music, he follows his intuition according to his various encounters, which surely explains how communicative his music is!
 
Photo credits: Thomas de Pourquery
 
Pour en savoir plus : https://bnpp.lk/culture
 
#culture #Jazz #art #music #musique #musician #artiste #Fondation'

b'They are between 15 and 18 years old and are one of the most promising French tennis hopes of their generation. Giulia, Jenny, Arthur, Antoine and Max joined the BNP Paribas Young Talents Team in association with the @fftennis, and they are all dreaming of becoming the champions of tomorrow. For almost 6 months, the @beinsports_fr teams have followed their journey: intensive training in Montpellier, tournament in Casablanca, physical and mental preparation or even college life\xe2\x80\xa6 -\n\nSeason 2 of the documentary \xe2\x80\x9cBleu Horizon\xe2\x80\x9d immerses us in the daily life of these five future champions and reveals behind the scenes of the BNP Paribas Young Talents Program. #tennis'

b'Immerse yourself in the daily life of the young hopefuls of French tennis with the members of the BNP Paribas Young Talents Team: Arthur Cazaux, Max Westphal, Antoine Ghibaudo, Giulia Morlet and Jenny Lim. \xe2\x80\x9cBleu Horizon\xe2\x80\x9d, a @beinsports_fr documentary.
.
.
.
#tennis #documentaire #sport #jeunes #teamjeunestalents #video #documentary #marseille'

b'In May 2018, we launched the \xe2\x80\x9cBNP Paribas Young Talents Team\xe2\x80\x9d in association with the @fftennis. This initiative aims to increase the chances of young hopefuls, deserving of reaching the highest level of tennis competition. To honor these young talents, @beinsports_fr is broadcasting, the second season of "Bleu Horizon", a behind-the-scenes documentary about the training of these young high-level players. How do you prepare to become a great tennis champion when you're a teenager? How to reconcile studies and training?
We are going to broadcast this documentary on our IGTV. Stay tuned! #TeamJeunesTalents .
.
.
.
#tennis #sport #documentaire #sport #potd #young #champion #instapic'

b'Did you know that :
-	The oceans are covering more than 70% of the World\xe2\x80\x99 surface ? .
-	That every year, between 8 and 12 million tons of plastic are thrown into the ocean ? .
-	That 100,000 marine animals & 1 million birds die each year from plastic waste ?
.
The protection of the oceans cannot \xe2\x80\x93 and should not \xe2\x80\x93 be considered a secondary priority for the main drivers of the global economy. It\xe2\x80\x99s not just a large portion of global economic resources that depend on the ocean\xe2\x80\x99s good health, but the whole planet\xe2\x80\x99s natural balance and climate. .
.

Discover our commitments : :right_arrow_selector:https://bnpp.lk/oceans .
.
.
:camera_with_flash:: James Thew.
.
#worldoceansday #ocean #plastic #potd #monday #sea'

b"[AlliesOfBNPP] Our partner associations are on the front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories.

Philippe Baudasse\xcc\x81, from the Samusocial de Paris:France: : \xe2\x80\x9c In this context, the Mieux Vivre a\xcc\x80 l'hotel mission develops with the users themselves, local players and in partnership with patrons projects aimed at improving the daily lives of families residing in social hotels. Actions are thus implemented in the areas of food; health and sports; education and parenting; culture, leisure and digital; social ties and access to common law services and support as close as possible to where they are based. The health crisis has deeply affected people by forcing them to stay confined to their rooms; those who had a small job often lost it; aid structures could not all remain open; social ties as well as pedagogical continuity were undermined. 
To fight against the pandemic, we prioritized our actions on the supply of basic necessities: thanks to sponsorship and numerous volunteers, we were able to transport approximately 165 tonnes of basic necessities to the 8 departments of Ile de France . Food, hygiene, specific products for babies (= approximately 9.3000 children under 3 years old). Currently, we are developing in parallel with partners actions around educational continuity: tutoring by phone, show on the phone (Allo l'Artiste program), coloring distribution and educational support, installation of 550 4G boxes to facilitate Internet access - for adolescents in particular whose school deadlines are important. \xe2\x80\x9c
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch
.
#sunday#dimanche#care#caregiver#association#BNPP#covid19#potd#portrait"

b'[#AlliesOfBNPP] Our partner associations are on the front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories. 
Anne-C\xc3\xa9cile Mailfert, President of \xc2\xab Fondation des Femmes \xc2\xbb :France: :
\xc2\xab The confinement was a real tragedy for the women victims of their partner. The figures show that the violence has intensified: there was almost twice as much police intervention at home over this period ... They were also less able to escape or to ask for help since their partner was constantly on their backs. The associations we support have therefore found it difficult to cope and our mission has been to help them, everywhere in France, not to leave any woman without solution. Deconfinement does not, however, represent the end of the crisis because associations see a massive increase in demands from women who are now "liberated". It is an influx that will require resources that they do not always have. 
Faced with the situation, from the first days of confinement, we switched the entire \xc2\xab Fondation des Femmes \xc2\xbbto emergency mode. Our goal has been to support a maximum of associations in contact with women in danger so that they can adapt their activity to the situation and meet the growing needs. The \xc2\xab Fondation des Femmes \xc2\xbb thus carried out an audit of needs throughout France, then launched an emergency collection to deal with this unprecedented crisis and was able to collect more than 2.5 million euros. These funds were redistributed to support associations in their transition to telework and allow them to continue to help, but also to unlock 40,000 nights of emergency accommodation, and buy basic necessities for the women who escaped. without having had time to prepare for their departure ... It also supported initiatives so that women could discreetly call for help, such as the 7/7 shift to the support chat for victims of violence commentonsaime.fr and the improvement of the App-Elles application which allows discreet alerting. In total, 125 associations and thousands of women all over France were able to be supported via our #ToutesSolidaires emergency system thanks to a massive mobilization of donors and patrons. \xc2\xbb

#association#caregiver#bnpp#covid19#potd#portrait'

b'[#AlliesOfBNPP]Our Partner associations are on the front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories. 
Emmanuel Landais, General Director of Adie :France: :
\xe2\x80\x9c Because it is unacceptable that in France, for lack of means, too many people cannot create their business, Adie allows, each year, 20,000 of them to carry out their project, by lending them up to 10,000 euros and by supporting them through its network of advisers, employees and volunteers, present throughout the territory. As of March 16, Adie completely reorganized, remotely, in order to continue its activities. Our priority has been to give our full support to entrepreneurs. We contacted them all, to provide them with advice, in particular on access to public aid, and to offer them suitable financing solutions (extension of deadlines, emergency loans). We have carried out 2 surveys which show that half of them are at risk of having to stop their activity very soon. This is the reason why we plead, in our \xe2\x80\x9cplea for an inclusive stimulus\xe2\x80\x9d, so that a public device of stimulus premiums is quickly set up, in addition to the honorary stimulus loans that we now offer, and to the financing of which BNP Paribas was the first bank to contribute. \xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#thursday#jeudi#association#care#business#adie#pme#tpe#bnpp#covid19#potd#portrait'

b'[#AlliesOfBNPP] Our partner associations are on the  front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories.
Vinciane Gautier, General Coordinator Le Petit v\xc3\xa9lo jaune :Belgium:: "Support parents to improve the well-being of children!  The assistance offered by Le Petit v\xc3\xa9lo jaune is organized by a meeting between a vulnerable family and a volunteer: The "teammate".
Each week the teammate goes to the family\xe2\x80\x99s home, always the same, free of charge to spend a few hours there. Together they try to resolve the difficulties expressed.
Since March, our volunteers can of course no longer go to families' homes. We were very anxious for many of them. But for the majority of the families we support, containment is organized rather well. Even if these families have little or no network. Even if many live in often cramped and dilapidated housing. Even if the majority are on social assistance and their daily lives are precarious. This is going well because the accompaniments are organized in other forms: discussion and encouragement by WhatsApp, deposit in front of the door of DIY materials, some basic shopping, proposal to do a laundry, etc. Often very simple things. Listening, advice, ideas to pass the time, to organize. In reality, for these families that we support, confinement does not go too badly because a relationship of solidarity and trust with the teammates volunteers already existed, upstream."
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch
.
.
#friday#vendredi#association#care#caregiver#volunteer#belgium#lepetitvelojaune#bnpp#bnppfortis#covid19#potd#portrait'

b'[#AlliesOfBNPP] Our partner associations are on the  front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories.
Francesco Rocca, President of the Italian Red Cross :Italy:: \xe2\x80\x9cOur aim is to alleviate human suffering, "everywhere and for anyone". The Italian Red Cross is a Volunteer organization born in the 19th century on the battlefields to bring relief to the wounded of each and every army. We are guided by 7 principles: Humanity, Impartiality, Neutrality, Independence, Voluntary Service, Unity, Universality. Today, over 160,000 Volunteers are distributed in over a thousand locations throughout Italy, working for health and social inclusion, in preparation and response to emergencies, for the promotion of humanitarian values, for a culture of volunteering, and to encourage active youth. The Covid-19 emergency has seen us on the front lines, since the beginning. We were born to face all those situations that seem to overwhelm the human being. Those who join the Red Cross make this choice as the first step. Yet, what is happening has put a strain on us too, aware that we are in a very complex, unpredictable scenario: the virus is an invisible enemy, capable of overpowering even the strongest will. We too had losses among our rescuers. But ItRC Volunteers passed this test, demonstrating unparalleled resilience. We are in hospitals, in ambulances, next to those who have nobody to bring them food or medicines, close to the homeless people. Ready, through our toll-free number, to give practical and psychological support to anyone in need. For us, this emergency meant confirming the capacity and potentiality of the largest humanitarian association in Italy. \xe2\x80\x9c
.
:paintbrush:@tyter_tanovitch
.
.
#friday#association#care#caregiver#redcross#croixrouge#covid19#bnpp#bnl#portrait#potd#GiornataMondialeCroceRossa#RedCrossDay #RedCrescentDay'

b'[#AlliesOfBNPP] Our partner associations are on the front line to fight against the pandemic, here is their stories.
Ericka Cogne, Director of Institut T\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9maque :France: : " Pioneer association for equal opportunities, Institut T\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9maque is promoting social ladder in France by helping young people from fragile areas in the general and professional education thanks to mentoring. To fight against the COVID19 crisis, we have switched all our activities into digital experiences to maintain the educational link and the learning continuity for young people: Virtual visits to museums with a T\xc3\xa9l\xc3\xa9maque guide, digital challenges to keep in touch, webinars on job presentation, training of mentors through digital tools, meetings between teachers & educational referents\xe2\x80\xa6 \xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#friday#vendredi#association#caregiver#care#covid19#youth#inclusion#education#support#potd#portrait'

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories. 
Gonzalo \xe2\x80\x93 Call Center Manager, Cetelem :Spain:: \xe2\x80\x9c I wanted to thank and congratulate all my colleagues for how you\xe2\x80\x99ve handled things during this crisis, on how you\xe2\x80\x99ve stayed calm and dealt with things in context.
All of you have kept your cool\xe2\x80\xa6 In just four hours, from 1 in the afternoon to 5 in the evening, we managed to get everyone in the team working from home. True, it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t all easy money, but you dealt with the problems that cropped up with nerves of steel and no worries. And I need to thank you for that. The company reacted really quickly and we were all working from home in just a matter of hours. So, that\xe2\x80\x99s something we should be thankful for, that reaction in record time. We must be one of the few companies to have managed that so quickly for everyone in the team. Of course, life goes on, and now we\xe2\x80\x99re all safe and sound in our homes. So, now we have to think about carrying on and doing our job. When clients are in difficulty, Cetelem helps them out, we refinance their debt, we give them lower interest rates and longer repayment terms, we defer payments and we write off fees\xe2\x80\xa6 And now  it\xe2\x80\x99s the ideal time to carry on helping our clients. It\xe2\x80\x99s important to showcase what we do and develop it even more. On the other hand, we need to keep on our toes, we\xe2\x80\x99re not going to be seeing each other every day, so, it\xe2\x80\x99s essential for us to keep in contact by phone, video and audio and group and one-to-one messages\xe2\x80\xa6\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#saturday#samedi#weekend#bnpp#bnpparibas#cetelem#employee#story#engagement#work#covid19#potd#portrait#takecare'

b"[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories.
Raffaella \xe2\x80\x93 Senior Banker, BNP Paribas BNL :Italy: : \xe2\x80\x9cI work in the Large Corporate team as a Senior Banker in the Fashion & Luxury sector. As you can imagine, for most of my clients in the fashion sector this is a really critical period. My clients have seen their stores shut down completely, first in China, when the Covid-19 emergency began, and now all over Europe, in the United States, and in South America. The factories that make their products, most of them in Italy, are all closed too. So you can imagine how difficult this time is for our clients, who need us to provide all the help we can. At the beginning of the lockdown, I was afraid that my relations with my clients and co-workers would suffer, as we couldn't see each other or meet face to face. In fact, exactly the opposite has happened. We're in regular contact with our clients, sometimes even several times a day.
My relations with them have grown so much stronger, and I feel they know they can really count on me at this time. My relations with my co-workers have grown much stronger too, we're really working much more intensively in this time. I've noticed everyone's totally ready to help each other. Lots of solidarity and lots of determination, but above all I've noticed a lot of positive energy. That's what's important to me right now, the most important thing, being close to my clients. It's important for clients to feel this positive energy we're emanating, so they know they can count on us. I believe I'll come out of this whole experience stronger than I was before.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch
.
.
#friday#vendredi#story#bnpp#bnpparibas#employee#engagement#work#care#clients#covid19#potd#portrait"

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories. 
Cenk \xe2\x80\x93 Sales Manager, BNP Paribas Leasing Solutions :Turkey: : \xe2\x80\x9cWe all need to realise that our world, as we knew it, is evolving into something never seen before, something new.
Our clients want to feel that they are not alone and that we are by their side to support them in this crisis . Expectations could be classified under 2 titles: clients operating in currently non-active sectors are concerned with  the postponement of rentals until the situation stabilises and clients operating in currently  active sectors ( such as healthcare and medicine, cleaning & hygiene products, food & beverage and other support  industries like packaging, logistic, chemical, textile ,e-trade, etc) are occupied with the financial support for their new and emerging investments. So we keep in touch with clients through phone calls, conference calls, video conferences and email. But also with our internal stakeholders, our colleagues working in the bank agencies of the BNP Paribas Group. In addition, we\xe2\x80\x99re directing them towards more digital platforms like the customer self-service tool \xe2\x80\x9cLease on the Web\xe2\x80\x9d to provide a faster solution for them. This situation showed people that health is more important than anything else. And showed corporate companies how important digitalisation and remote working capability is. I believe that - as it is still being experienced successfully- digitalisation and remote working will be more common in our business life even after the crisis is over.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#thursday#jeudi#bnpp#bnpparibas#turkey#turquie#employee#story#engagement#work#covid19#potd#portrait'

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories. 
Michael \xe2\x80\x93 Head of Retail Banking, BNP Paribas Fortis :Belgium:: \xe2\x80\x9c One of Gabriel Garcia Marquez\xe2\x80\x99 masterpieces was called \xe2\x80\x9cLove in the time of cholera\xe2\x80\x9d. We are all writing our chapters in \xe2\x80\x9cWork in the time of corona\xe2\x80\x9d. In these challenging times, BNP Paribas Fortis is there for its customers, for the economy, for the society, for its staff and their loved ones. More than ever, we as a bank need to show and to demonstrate we are present. We should do this in the spirit of Mary Poppins: at the service of others, using our magic to help people and where possible with a touch of humour. Let\xe2\x80\x99s not forget this last one in these times. Last week I was very privileged to see the resiliance, the strenght and the stamina of many people in BNP Paribas Fortis to make this happen. Very proud to be working with you. A special thought for our colleagues in Italy BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas Keep up the morale and all the efforts. This can only make you stronger and better.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#saturday#samedi#weekend#bnpparibas#bnpp#bnppfortis#belgium#employees#story#engagement#work#bank#covdi19#potd'

b"[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories. 
Sandrine \xe2\x80\x93 IT Manager, IT Group :France:: \xe2\x80\x9cIn a crisis, you tend to go back to basics. You ask yourself questions like: What does my job mean? What is its purpose? What service do I deliver? You focus on what's important rather than administrative problems. In my view, you get a clearer, concrete perception of your role and the value that you contribute. I work for the BNP Paribas Group's IT. By producing applications for the Group's Functions and the Group itself, we ultimately serve all bank users. In these strange times, people have had high expectations of the IT team. We found ourselves dealing with \xe2\x80\x9cdouble trouble\xe2\x80\x9d now that everyone is working remotely.  We had to keep IT services running smoothly so that people can do their job and stay in contact, while overcoming the difficulties faced by our team and its members individually. It was necessary to adapt the availability of IT systems and applications so that each user could connect and work from home. In the early days of confinement, that represented quite a hurdle because of the sheer size of our workload. The profiles of application use were changing in a big way and, at the same time, the volume and frequency of from-home connections via VPNs surged. The objective was to keep systems going so that, for each employee, it would be \xe2\x80\x9cbusiness as usual\xe2\x80\x9d insofar as possible. Everyone had to be more committed at the level of our teams. And each member of the IT team committed to making that happen. They say every cloud has a silver lining. In this crisis, I would say the silver lining is the way individuals have stepped up to serve the community, our business and our customers. I thank all of my colleagues. I know it's been hard for everyone. Many users tend to have a negative view of IT and, on that score, I have to thank you for showing understanding. On our side, we'll be doing everything possible to make the applications available and keep them running. Last but not least, everyone, take good care and stay safe!
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
#friday#vendredi#drawing#bnpparibas#bnpp#story#employee#covid19#potd"

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Every day / every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories. 
Wilfried \xe2\x80\x93 branch manager, Retail banking :France: : \xe2\x80\x9c We are playing a key role, as bankers, in supporting the economy and businesses, and I think, even if it is not overly visible in the media, we will have an even more important role in supporting the economic revival that is to come. Today, clients want reassurance about the continuity and durability of the banking service as a whole in this very difficult climate where some companies are forced to close down. They also expect from us economic solutions, given the short-time working required for some of them and company closures facing others. On one hand, it is showing that we are still here for them, to grant credit if necessary, either cash loans or other forms. On the other hand, to suspend deadlines for loans, which we are doing every day. The most difficult thing for us is overcoming the shortage of staff, because unfortunately, some of our colleagues have had to stay at home. Even though, the number of requests from customers is dropping, it is difficult to set up an organization and adapt it in order to always respond instantly to clients. A second difficulty we are having is all these changes. Organizational changes, as I\xe2\x80\x99ve said, changes in the different processes to be used, changes also occasioned by Government measures, which change from day to day, or at least weekly, and we can clearly see that the company is trying to position itself in relation to that. It is not always easy. What are the positives we will take away from this crisis? We see is a build-up of solidarity between teams, which was already present, and which is of necessity more visible in times of crisis, when there is a pooling of strengths and a certain unity develops, we have advisers from some branches who are helping other branches out and vice versa. Whether they are advisers, branch managers or management team members. It is great to see that.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch
.
.
#thursday#jeudi#drawing#bnpparibas#bnpp#story#employee#engagement#work#france#bank#covid19#potd'

As you may know, many tennis tournaments have been canceled or postponed due to COVID19. Therefore we're happy to announce you that the points @felixaliassime has earned in 2019 will be recorded under the #FAAPointsForChange project. That means 1661 additional points! .

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Everyday /every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories.
Carolina \xe2\x80\x93 Digital Project Manager at Cetelem :Spain:: \xe2\x80\x9cI am proud to work in a company such as Cetelem where, from day one, all measures have been taken to take care of each employee. From the day our government established the state of alarm, we have been able to work from home even if most of us did not have the authorizations required before. Indeed, our IT teams made a tremendous work in just one week to allow to about 98% of employees to work from home. Since the beginning, our IT department and all the board members have done everything to maintain a highly secured environment in order for us to keep responding to our clients\xe2\x80\x99 needs. In these difficult times, we will give our best and this will make us collectively stronger.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#saturday#samedi#weekend#drawing#bnpp#story#employee#engagement#spain#espagne#bank#covid19#potd'

b'[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Everyday /every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories.
Giorgio \xe2\x80\x93 Global Security at Cardif :Italy:: \xe2\x80\x9c Since 2000, I\xe2\x80\x99m a volunteer at Seregno Soccorso,  a volounteer organization that manages first aid in my city in Lombardia. I started as an emergency technician, then became an ambulance driver, and now I am an instructor, managing these missions after work hours.  I volunteered in the ambulance for 18 years, both as driver and as a first aider, and for the last 2 years I have been driving medical cars dedicated to serious emergencies, together with a doctor and a nurse. For the COVID emergency in Lombardia, I am back working in the ambulance, doing first aid on my geographical area, Monza in Lombardia, which is one of the most exposed area. I also spend some time on a specific Covid Call Center where people can call and obtain precious sanitary information.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
:paintbrush: @tyter_tanovitch .
.
#friday#vendredi#drawing#bnpparibas#bnpp#story#employee#engagement#work#italy#italie#bank#covid19#potd'

b"[#PeopleofBNPP:man_and_woman_holding_hands:] Everyday /every week, our colleagues from all over the world tell their stories.
Julie - patrimonial advisor, Retail Banking :France:: \xe2\x80\x9cI do not save lives and yet I am part of those who continue to work. Although we don\xe2\x80\x99t hear about us, we the bank employees, I get up every morning wondering what\xe2\x80\x99s going to happen today. I feel useful, especially to the elderly clients: most of them are alone and don't talk to anyone all day long. My clients are worried about their considerable drop in income, the postponement of their loan. Some of them have a sick relative, or sometimes, they just need to keep in touch with the outside world. So no, I don't save lives. But I feel useful, I feel important to my clients who need help or who just need to feel listened to. It\xe2\x80\x99s also hard for us: we have children, families but we are here. Everyday. For our businesses. For our customers. I love my job and today I see it differently. I have the feeling I am being the social bond of these people. So tonight, as every night, I will applaud and thank the medical staff. But I will also applaud and thank all my colleagues, from all the banks, from all countries. And a special thanks to colleagues of my wonderful agency, Marseille Prado.\xe2\x80\x9d
.
.
.
#jeudi#thursday#people#story#drawing#bnpp#employee#work#bank#covid19#potd"

As part of our @heforshe commitment, a year ago BNP Paribas decided to support the @unwomen initiative called AgriFed. It simultaneously addresses multiple @unitednations SDGs such as hunger, poverty, gender inequality and climate action and aims to empower 30,000 Senegalese women farmers by 2021. .

b'[#BNPPTime]

To have access to credit lines, female rice farmers are organized in Economic Interest Groups. 
Acc to @fao, eliminating gender disparity could increase agricultural returns by up to 30%.
However lack of access to finance and climate change are two major hurdles for the farm productivity
.

b'[#BNPPTime]

Female smallholder entrepreneurship in Northern Senegal has been challenged by rural exodus caused by unemployment. 
Rural women are almost 70% of Senegal\xe2\x80\x99s workforce and produce 80% of the country\xe2\x80\x99s food. Empowering them is critical to developing agriculture and rural areas
.
:camera_with_flash: @pariswanderer for @unwomen .
.
.
.
.
#women #sustainability #empowerment #senegal #africa #kebetu #potd #girlboss #portrait #instapic #agriculture #unwomen'
